{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3008546,"name":"","username":"sbailey","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/4491bb/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-02-16T20:52:18.114Z","cooked":"

hello, I am reaching out about our Spark Maxâ€™s. We have 6 Spark Max that we have created a CAN bus with. When you run the robot only the first, third, and fifth Sparks work from the CAN bus. We changed the order of the sparks but again the first, third, and fifth sparks in the bus worked. We have pushed new code, reinitialized them, and looked for solutions with nothing work. Are we missing something?

Hello! There are many possible root causes of the symptoms described. Have you gone through REVâ€™s guides for troubleshooting? It has a number of procedures and ideas to try to help narrow down the cause.

Have you connected them to your computer with USB-C and configured them with the REV Hardware Client? If so, do they all show up in the client and have unique IDâ€™s?

sbailey:

We changed the order of the sparks but again the first, third, and fifth sparks in the bus worked

If Iâ€™m reading that correctly then youâ€™ve verified all of the Sparks are good (by changing positions), just that they donâ€™t all work when you want them to? Can you link to a github repo with your code?

I suspect you have 3 different sets of ids assigned, and the first one in line responds, the second inline with the same id doesnâ€™t. on your latest case, 1 and 2 likely have the same id, and 3 and 4 have the same id?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-02-16T21:29:49.991Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":45.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":403172,"topic_slug":"only-alternating-spark-max-work","display_username":"Zyrano","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51476,"username":"sbailey","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/4491bb/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/only-alternating-spark-max-work/403172/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3008587,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-16T21:33:44.572Z","cooked":"

The code you uploaded is not valid. You do not have the REV vendor library installed and the Robot.java file has nothing more than a package declaration.

I have a feeling you have duplicate IDs, but it could also be a wiring problem. Can you share a screenshot of the REV Hardware Client when youâ€™re connected to the Sparks?

Suggested reading: Basic Setup and Configuration

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-02-16T21:35:43.933Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":39.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":403172,"topic_slug":"only-alternating-spark-max-work","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.revrobotics.com/sparkmax/gs-sm/connect-a-spark-max-over-usb#basic-setup-and-configuration","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Make it Spin! - SPARK MAX","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51476,"username":"sbailey","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/4491bb/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/only-alternating-spark-max-work/403172/10","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3008604,"name":"","username":"sbailey","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/4491bb/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-02-16T21:50:24.878Z","cooked":"

Got the code to work on google, should work now

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-02-16T21:50:24.878Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":18.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":403172,"topic_slug":"only-alternating-spark-max-work","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":44380,"username":"gdefender","name":"Andy Gasser","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51476,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/only-alternating-spark-max-work/403172/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3008615,"name":"dyanoshak","username":"dyanoshak","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dyanoshak/{size}/65422_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-16T22:08:15.582Z","cooked":"
sbailey:

only the first, third, and fifth Sparks work from the CAN bus.

This sounds like it could be a wiring issue, where the CAN H and CAN L wires are flipped at each junction, consistently throughout the chain. In other words, every other SPARK MAX is connected to the CAN bus backwards.

Send a photo of your wiring, and/or reach out to our support team at support@revrobotics.com. Weâ€™d be happy to help further troubleshooting!

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-02-16T22:08:15.582Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":64,"readers_count":63,"score":82.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":403172,"topic_slug":"only-alternating-spark-max-work","display_username":"dyanoshak","primary_group_name":"REV","flair_name":"REV","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/d/b/db93216ec14c273ae2ca04aa396186c0461d0620.png","flair_bg_color":"F05A28","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":55,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"REV Robotics","title_is_group":false,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9020,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/only-alternating-spark-max-work/403172/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3009144,"name":"","username":"sbailey","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/4491bb/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-02-17T21:48:09.590Z","cooked":"

we figured it out. Turned out to be a flipped connection. Thank you for the help!

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-02-17T21:48:09.590Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":42,"readers_count":41,"score":28.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":403172,"topic_slug":"only-alternating-spark-max-work","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":9020,"username":"dyanoshak","name":"dyanoshak","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dyanoshak/{size}/65422_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51476,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/only-alternating-spark-max-work/403172/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3009213,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-02-18T00:19:07.533Z","cooked":"

The post I made in another thread is relevant here since the cause of the problem was the same.

Mystery CAN issue - irregular status lights CAN
After a set of connections are made, the person doing the work should be checking each and every wire to ensure it is connected correctly. Then have someone who is meticulous check it all again, wire by wire, connection by connection. One should only apply power only after all the connections are verified to be correct. It sounds tedious and it is. It sounds like it takes a while and it does but it takes much less time than trying to troubleshoot it while it is doing weird and unexplainable thinâ€¦
